meanings.definition: A device consisting of a screw and a hook, used for adjusting the tension or length of ropes or cables.
meanings.sent1: The sailor adjusted the ropes on the ship using turnbuckles.
meanings.sent2: The construction worker tightened the cables with turnbuckles.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey tried to play with the turnbuckles on the swing set.
meanings.sent4: The turnbuckles of communication kept the team connected during the project.
meanings.sent5: The shiny turnbuckles gleamed in the sunlight as they held the structure together.

meanings.definition: To secure or tighten with turnbuckles.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic will turnbuckle the metal beams for extra support.
meanings.sent2: Please turnbuckle the tent securely before the wind picks up.
meanings.sent3: He tried to turnbuckle his backpack closed, but it was too full.
meanings.sent4: Her determination acted as a turnbuckle, keeping her focused on her goal.
meanings.sent5: The coach's pep talk served as a turnbuckle, motivating the team to give their best performance.
